snippet: Consciousness is not a simple state that is either on or off. Studies with anesthesia showed patients responding to commands or communicating, but later having no memory of doing so.
abstract: Researchers are using anesthesia, in combination with brain scans, to better define the distinction between consciousness and unconsciousness; studies have found that patients under certain types of anesthesia can respond to simple commands, even though their higher-level brain functioning is not active.
lead_paragraph: Consciousness is not a simple state that is either on or off. Studies with anesthesia showed patients responding to commands or communicating, but later having no memory of doing so.

headline.main: Awake or Knocked Out? The Line Gets Blurrier
